variable.name: raw1
variable.description: Interleukin-6 raw OD reading for first well

variable.name: blcor1
variable.description: Interleukin-6 baseline corrected OD reading for first well

variable.name: conc1
variable.comment: If CONC1 was less than or equal to the lowest detectable limit of 0.15 pg/ml, then CONC1 was set to 0.15 pg/ml.

variable.name: raw2
variable.description: Interleukin-6 raw OD reading for second well

variable.name: blcor2
variable.description: Interleukin-6 baseline corrected OD reading for second well

variable.name: conc2
variable.comment: If CONC2 was less than or equal to the lowest detectable limit of 0.15 pg/ml, then CONC2 was set to 0.15 pg/ml.

variable.name: mresult
variable.comment: The mean result was only calculated if the sample was done in duplicate. To keep results consistent, the first concentration was used as the final IL6 reading for all samples (Variable IL6).

variable.name: il6
variable.comment: For flag = 1, 2 or 3, IL6 is the same as CONC1 regardless of whether the sample was done in duplicate or not. If IL6 was less than or equal to the lowest detectable limit of 0.15 pg/ml, then IL6 was set to 0.15 pg/ml.

variable.name: flag
variable.comment: When doing analysis, use the variable IL6 where flag = 1 and 2. Phantoms have their FHS ID number listed under IDTYPE and ID, with their phantom id number listed under PHANTOM_ID. When looking at phantom samples, use flag = 3 records as well as their corresponding FHS ID numbers in either flag = 1 or 2.
variable.value: FHS samples that can be used for analysis, done in singleton
FHS samples that can be used for analysis, done in duplicate
